content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, StudioPress Sites goes live; donate to ACLU and get a free Design Palette Pro basic licence; plus, a free, new course for WordPress beginners to level up their PHP development skills.

StudioPress Sites launches

After lots of speculation, StudioPress Sites went live this week over at studiopress.com, where there are a lot more details and a handy FAQ.

If you’re wondering what it looks like behind the scenes though you might want to take a look at these two video walkthroughs from Erin Flynn and Kristie Hill. Edit (6 Feb): Helena Denley has also published a video walkthrough.

Not interested in Sites? Don’t worry all of the previous StudioPress themes are still available to purchase (and use on your own hosting plan), via the Shop For Themes page.

Brian Gardner’s also been continuing to answer questions over on the Facebook Group.

Of course it’s too early to say exactly how StudioPress Sites will turn out, but Rainmaker Digital’s Brian Clark is clearly happy with the reaction and what his team have done.

In fact, the @studiopress and #genesiswp crowd is owning it. Thank you, and more goodness is coming your way.

— Brian Clark (@brianclark) February 2, 2017

Themes

SEO Themes launches a free, new starter theme (though you’ll need to share it in order to download it).

Just released a #genesiswp starter theme which is free for a limited time only! Share for a 100% discount https://t.co/v0z4GThG2Q

— Seo Themes (@seothemeswp) February 5, 2017

Andrei Chira puts out a free, new Genesis theme called MASA.

MASA is available for download – https://t.co/4CmwH9qsDR #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/ORTulYkui6

— Andrei Chira (@andreichira7) February 3, 2017

Jesse Petersen is working on the finishing touches to his blogging theme, due to released under his GenesisThe.me brand.

I just put my @_GenesisTheme blogging theme in a new blog of mine & found a couple of things to fix. Then it's going on sale. #genesiswp

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) February 3, 2017

If you’re interested in Calvin Koepke’s forthcoming starter theme, you might want to follow his new Twitter account for it, @starter_theme.

So, you might want to follow this account. Just sayin' –> @starter_theme #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) February 2, 2017

ZigZagPress are doing a 40% off sale, with code GETSLUSH (though it sounds like today might be the last day).

This week: get 40% off all ZigzagPress #genesiswp themes with code GETSLUSH https://t.co/NWfQ4bUnDL

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) January 31, 2017

Showcase

First up this week, Brian Gardner reveals that Carrie Fisher’s website – carriefisher.com – is built with Genesis.

Just found out that @carrieffisher’s website is built on #genesiswp and @beaverbuilder.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) February 4, 2017

Place North re-launches their website, placenorth.co.uk

a bold #genesiswp design for place north https://t.co/47tRDYxNSC @studiopress

— Place North (@place_north) February 1, 2017

ChillyBin Web Design for donwalker.com.au

A new custom #genesiswp site has just gone live to the public for Australian musician and writer Don Walker – https://t.co/iyVZIPrNa9 pic.twitter.com/8S2LQdm38K

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) February 1, 2017

Stephanie Hellwig with a new site for breannamegan.com

Super excited to share recent #genesiswp #wordpress launch for https://t.co/M8ZYU2qoFa a fabulous #interiordesign artist pic.twitter.com/T4j52EIYJv

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) February 2, 2017

Neil Gee for kzg.com

Custom #GenesisWP launch for https://t.co/73Osmt1iVq 'Keraluft Zirconium Golf’ pic.twitter.com/DBmgQPguN7

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) February 2, 2017

Lisa B for yogapresence.net.au

Latest website launch. A #yoga studio in Goulburn, NSW. https://t.co/pZQeZv5Yhu#WordPress #genesiswp #webdesign pic.twitter.com/lyYAK32Eu6

— Lisa B (@lmbva) January 31, 2017

And Pornhub launches a new sex and wellness blog on Genesis, pornhub.com/sex/

Powered by #WordPress and #GenesisWP https://t.co/hfW5n3xMt0

— Jeseph Meyers (@jesephm) February 2, 2017

Best of the rest

If you’re a WordPress beginner looking to level up your development skills then what better than this free video course from Tonya Mork, an incredible teacher and founder of Know The Code.

[NEW] #PHP 101: Gentle Introduction to #WordPress Programming. Come do this FREE 3.4 hr lab https://t.co/Md4NE5V0fd #GenesisWP #LevelUp

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) February 1, 2017

Sridhar Katakam on how to remove post info from a specific post in Genesis.

How to remove post info from a specific post in Genesis:https://t.co/asDPJGFtie#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/FOlzCiLxnJ

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) February 1, 2017

Rebecca Gill is looking for people to potentially refer Genesis customisation work to, over at Web Savvy Marketing.

If you've built a #genesiswp site on our themes, we'd love to see it AND showcase your work. Reply back or DM us URLs that make you proud.

— Web Savvy Marketing (@WebSavvyMrkting) January 31, 2017

And finally…

Design Palette Pro is offering a free Basic licence to everyone who donates to the ACLU.

on the fence about donating to the ACLU? how about a free Basic license for your trouble? details here: https://t.co/GA0DwGwYxj

— Design Palette Pro (@DesignPalette) January 31, 2017

And they’ve also just updated the plugin to support two new child themes, Wellness Pro and Smart Passive Income Pro.

What’s that you say? A new release for Design Palette is available? https://t.co/uE8jwpIcYF

— Design Palette Pro (@DesignPalette) February 2, 2017

—

That’s all for this week.

Got something awesome to share? Go add it! Want to support what I’m doing? Subscribe!

Until next time, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

excerpt.rendered: StudioPress Sites goes live; donate to ACLU and get a free Design Palette Pro basic licence; plus, a free, new course for WordPress beginners to level up their PHP development skills.
